newsitem.title: CHINA: China announces new tariff system for crude oil.
newsitem.headline: China announces new tariff system for crude oil.

text.p: China will implement a specific import tariff on crude oil of 16 yuan ($1.90) per tonne from July 1, the State Council Customs Office said on Tuesday.
Previously, import tariffs were calculated according to the value of the item but from July 1 the tariffs would be calculated based on the quantity, a Customs Office spokesmans said.
The start date of July 1 was a preliminary proposal and a final decision on the tariff and when to implement it would be taken after an assessment of industry reponses, he said.
State media said China would adopt the new system in line with tariff calculation methods used in several other countries.
